TopicTitle: Need your own thread moved or locked? Post here.

Articles.Content:
Can you close this thread? http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/29661-TT-s-Mod-Releases-Development-suspended-till-further-notice

Why? The mod author is back leave it up to TT if the thread should be closed

It should because I think TT said that he won't update anymore and now it's just SpacePort downloads.

Oops! That's the wrong link! Here is the link that I meant to put: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24970-0-21-Kosmos-Spacecraft-Design-Bureau-Updated-%289-27-13%29 because I don't think that he is updating anymore.

I want somebody to check out EFC and/or Harran Aerospace because I got no replies yet.

Edited September 9, 2014 by KasperVld

It should because I think TT said that he won't update anymore and now it's just SpacePort downloads.

The fact remains you are not TT this isn't your call especially if you only "think" he said that. Its good that you want to keep things tidy but leave it to TT who is active again hence why the thread has gotten a recent burst in activity to decide what to do with his threads.
In this case, since TouhouTorpedo is active again, we should probably leave the decision of whether or not he wants his thread closed to him.

I meant to put KOSMOS but I didn't know that you had to leave it up to the creator of the thread, sorry! I will delete everything about this! But can somebody still reply to EFC and/or Harran Aerospace?

I meant to put KOSMOS but I didn't know that you had to leave it up to the creator of the thread, sorry! I will delete everything about this! But can somebody still reply to EFC and/or Harran Aerospace?

Huh, didn't notice those in the thread earlier... The EFC and Harran Aerospace threads should now be closed.

Specialist290: I didn't want you to close my thread I wanted you to check it out and reply!

Specialist290: I said reply not close!!

I have to re-create EFC and Harran Aerospace!

Edited September 9, 2014 by sal_vager
Links to the threads please CDK
I found it Sal, and opened it.
Sorry, misinterpreted your request. Mea culpa ;

Sorry, misinterpreted your request.

It's fine.
Are mods able to move individual posts between threads?
It's unusual for us to have to do so, but yes it can be done.
Can somebody close this thread? http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/85891-Cool-title
It's been closed, CDK.
Thanks again Vanamonde!

It's unusual for us to have to do so, but yes it can be done.

Could a moderator please take this post (#202) and all the ones after it and append them all to the end of this thread?

Both threads were started by me and I'd just like to keep all discussion regarding the development of landing gears in one place for everyone to access easily.

Cheers
Sure, on it now
Ah. Better call sal. Thanks

I'm looking for thread http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/71030-Quantum-Struts-Continued-(2014-07-24)-24/ : I find plenty of references to it in current threads, but the link itself just gives an error and I've found no new one. Moving it to another section would not have done that, right? (The link should keep working even if moved, if I understand it, but I thought I'd check here.)

Thanks.
The link works for me odmonk but it's a closed thread.

I get the same message ("Invalid thread specified.") as I do for archived threads, not locked threads. Even if it's locked, it would help to move it back into Add-on Releases since it received a compatibility update for KSP 0.24.

Hmm, it is in addon releases though, I'll try unlocking it.

Edit:

Unlocked but I can't post to it :/

Edit2:

It is missing licence information so has been made inaccessible, please see the licensing rules.

Edited September 13, 2014 by sal_vager

Now that I think about, the only other time I've seen the Invalid thread message was when The Mac OS X Thread was moved between forums during the reorganization. I actually get a different message for appropriately archived threads.

Thanks for figuring out the problem. I'd have uploaded my old copy, but I couldn't find the license even in toadicus's Git.

Yeah it's a pain in the butt to be honest, I can add the license to the forum page if there is one but there just isnt, so it's all rights reserved but Squad needs it in the zip as well in case the forum is lost.
